Hello Brend,
 
Thank You Very much for your reply.
Yes i do think, I am restricted  intentionally to check the output.
As i introduced fail method, the errors are displayed in the failure trace.
with that now concentrating on the coding part.And once again thanks for the reply.
 
Cheers,
Jaya

berndq <berndq@...> wrote:
arujay2002 wrote:

> A part of the system code contains 15 tests and when i run them 
> individually or all together the tests are successful.
> The query is,i am not able to see the output?

this is by intention: there should be no output on the console, you 
really don't want to read/understand/check all that output.

Your test runner should just tell you whether all your tests have passed 
or not (and which one did not pass)


> Also i tried to introduce a println in tests to check whether i am 
> getting the result.I do get the outputs.
> 
> Can anyone suggest me with ideas how can i proceed further ?

temp. make one test fail, e.g.  add
fail ("this is by intention");

this should be reported by your test runner

Bernd
